channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023070887
item.description:
Report X-2023070887

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Improper handling in trailer. Package was dropped during unload and broke item. DescribePack: Package was dropped causing glass bottle to break. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: segregated from other packages

item.title: Report X-2023070813
item.description:
Report X-2023070813

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: ONE CAN OF SUNNYSIDE DENATURED ALCOHOL WAS DENTED AT SOME POINT DURING TRANSIT CAUSING INTERNAL CONTENTS TO LEAK THROUGHOUT PKG. PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA FOR PROCESSING. PKG WILL BE HELD AT STATION WAITING FOR DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: BODY OF CAN WAS DENTED CAUSING IT TO CRACK AND CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A SPILL TOTE AND BOUGHT TO QA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023070688
item.description:
Report X-2023070688

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being discovered, the package was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: One of the containers had less liquid than the others and the package had staining from the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a spill tote to prevent further spillage

item.title: Report E-2023070670
item.description:
Report E-2023070670

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: OAK GROVE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While at the Pilot Truck Stop in Oak Grove, Ky on I24 at exit 89 the XPO driver discovered that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of polycat 33 (un2264) had been punctured by other freight during transit and had released 20 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
